title: Bob Barker, 95, wears cheerful bright yellow as he is pushed along in a wheelchair in Beverly Hills
text:
Bob Barker was in cheerful bright yellow when he was seen out in Beverly Hills this week.

The 95-year-old TV icon, who hosted The Price Is Right from 1972 to 2007, was being pushed along in a wheelchair down the sidewalk.

He was dressed in a comfortable and cozy-looking outfit including a midnight blue jacket to ward off the autumnal chill.

Out and about: Bob Barker was in cheerful bright yellow when he was seen out in Beverly Hills this week

The beloved nonagenarian became an entertainment icon during his 35 years on The Price Is Right and has won 19 Emmy Awards over the course of his career.

In recent years, Bob has hit the headlines after a series of medical problems including a fall this January that left him hospitalized for four months.

Last October, he had what his manager told Fox News was a 'non-emergency back injury,' and two weeks later paramedics took him to the hospital for back pain.

In June of 2017, his representative told Entertainment Tonight he took a spill and struck the back of his head in his bathroom at home, resulting in a hospital visit.

On the go: The 95-year-old TV icon, who hosted The Price Is Right from 1972 to 2007, was being pushed along in a wheelchair down the sidewalk

Two years previously, he had wound up in the hospital after hitting his head in another fall, this time on his front lawn as police were driving by.

'I just went for a little stroll. Harmless, and I ended up in the hospital,' said the TV legend to Entertainment Tonight.

He said of the cops: 'They had me out of here and to the emergency hospital in no time at all. I'm telling you the good Lord was watching over me.'

Keeping warm: He was dressed in a comfortable and cozy-looking outfit including a midnight blue jacket to ward off the autumnal chill

Bob's only marriage was to one Dorothy Jo Gideon and lasted from 1945 until her death in 1981, resulting in no children.

In 1994, he was sued for sexual harassment by The Price Is Right model Dian Parkinson, whom he admitted to dating from 1989 to 1994.

She dropped the lawsuit the following year, citing health concerns and Bob's superior 'power and resources' in a statement quoted by the Associated Press.
